alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 10:04PM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ FRIDAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
